ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Journalism writing, structure, techniques, how to source appropriately, alternative forms of journalism
I gained a lot of knowledge about journalism style writing and how to be clear while still keeping the piece interesting. I also learned a lot about the industry itself.

I learned so much in this course. Going straight to sources, honest reporting, learning about the current state of education. She also brought in so many interesting guest speakers and gave great help on our essays.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Guest speakers, assignments, readings, class environment

Weaknesses: none!

It is strong in the way that you write and get extremely clear and constructive feedback, but the classes themselves were oftentimes guest speakers, which was also great, but this means each class varied based on how engaging the speakers were.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Take this class. You learn so much about both education and the world of journalism!

Absolutely. This course showed me how much fun writing could be. It introduced me to a new style from someone who has immense experience and expertise in the field. It was one of my favorite courses I have taken at Yale, and it influenced what I will do when I graduate.

Yes I would recommend it! Prof Karr is so nice and funny and genuine. She will be tough on you at times, but only to help you succeed. I learned a great deal in this class about how to write Times-worthy pieces. She fosters a fun class environment and is super chill (but also you need to make sure you do the readings and hand in essays on time!).
